task.name: hif_setjy
task.shortdescription: Fill the model column with calibrated visibilities
task.description:
Fills the model column with the model visibilities.
Issues
Support for the setjy spix parameter needs to be added.
Output
results -- If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.

param.name: vis
param.description: The list of input MeasurementSets. Defaults to the list of MeasurementSets defined in the pipeline context.

param.name: field
param.shortdescription: List of field names or ids
param.description:
The list of field names or field ids for which the models are to be set. Defaults to all fields with intent '*AMPLITUDE*'.
example: field='3C279', field='3C279, M82'

param.name: intent
param.description:
A string containing a comma delimited list of intents against which the selected fields are matched. Defaults to all data with amplitude intent.
example: intent='*AMPLITUDE*'

param.name: spw
param.description:
The list of spectral windows and channels for which bandpasses are computed. Defaults to all science spectral windows.
example: spw='11,13,15,17'

param.name: model
param.description:
Model image for setting model visibilities. Not fully supported.
example: see details in help for CASA setjy task

param.name: reffile
param.shortdescription: Path to file with fluxes for non-solar system calibrators
param.description:
Path to a file containing flux densities for calibrators unknown to CASA. Values given in this file take precedence over the CASA-derived values for all calibrators except solar system calibrators. By default the path is set to the CSV file created by h_importdata, consisting of catalogue fluxes extracted from the ASDM.
example: reffile='', reffile='working/flux.csv'

param.name: reffreq
param.description:
The reference frequency for spix, given with units. Provided to avoid division by zero. If the flux density is being scaled by spectral index, then reffreq must be set to whatever reference frequency is correct for the given fluxdensity and spix. It cannot be determined from vis. On the other hand, if spix is 0, then any positive frequency can be used and will be ignored.
example: reffreq='86.0GHz', reffreq='4.65e9Hz'

param.name: fluxdensity
param.shortdescription: Specified flux density [I,Q,U,V]; -1 will lookup values
param.description:
Specified flux density [I,Q,U,V] in Jy. Uses [1,0,0,0] flux density for unrecognized sources, and standard flux densities for ones recognized by 'standard', including 3C286, 3C48, 3C147, and several planets, moons, and asteroids.
example: [3.06,0.0,0.0,0.0]

param.name: spix
param.description: Spectral index for fluxdensity S = fluxdensity * (freq/reffreq)**spix Only used if fluxdensity is being used. If fluxdensity is positive, and spix is nonzero, then reffreq must be set too. It is applied in the same way to all polarizations, and does not account for Faraday rotation or depolarization.

param.name: scalebychan
param.shortdescription: Scale the flux density on a per channel basis or else on a per spw basis
param.description: This determines whether the fluxdensity set in the model is calculated on a per channel basis. If False then only one fluxdensity value is calculated per spw.

param.name: standard
param.description:
Flux density standard, used if fluxdensity[0] less than 0.0. The options are: 'Baars','Perley 90','Perley-Taylor 95', 'Perley-Taylor 99', 'Perley-Butler 2010' and 'Butler-JPL-Horizons 2010'.
default: 'Butler-JPL-Horizons 2012' for solar system object 'Perley-Butler 2010' otherwise

param.name: pipelinemode
param.description:
The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In interactive mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task.
default: 'automatic'.

param.name: dryrun
param.shortdescription: Run the task (False) or display the commands (True)
param.description: Run the commands (True) or generate the commands to be run but do not execute (False).

param.name: acceptresults
param.shortdescription: Automatically accept results into the context
param.description: Add the results of the task to the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False).

task.example:
1. Set the model flux densities for all the amplitude calibrators:
hif_setjy()
